title: Inside Meta’s big bet on new AI technology
description: Meta, the company that owns Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp, has agreed to buy a fast-growing artificial intelligence company called Manus. The deal is reported to be worth more than US$2bil (RM8.1bil), making it one of Meta's bigger purchases ever.
content: MENLO PARK: Meta, the company that owns Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp, has agreed to buy a fast-growing artificial intelligence company called Manus. The deal is reported to be worth more than US$2bil (RM8.1bil), making it one of Meta’s bigger pur... [1172 chars]

title: Hindustan copper share price tanks 3%: What's behind the fall?
description: Copper prices have risen sharply this year due to supply disruptions at key global mines and strong demand from sectors such as electrification, renewable energy and artificial intelligence-led infrastructure.
content:
Shares of Hindustan Copper fell nearly 3% in Tuesday’s trade as investors chose to book profits after the stock’s sharp rise in recent weeks.
The fall came even as the broader outlook for copper remains strong, supported by global demand and supply c... [1658 chars]

title: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang says will have kids only after Elon Musk’s Neuralink …
description: Tech News News: Alexandr Wang, the head of Meta’s artificial intelligence division — SuperIntelligence Labs has now gave a new statement on his plans of having kids. .
content: Alexandr Wang, the head of Meta’s artificial intelligence division — SuperIntelligence Labs has now gave a new statement on his plans of having kids. Speaking at The Shawn Rayan Show, Wang said that he wait until Elon Musk’s Neuralink or similar brai... [2030 chars]

title: How a US startup is using AI to stop human trafficking
description: Human trafficking networks are complex. But for more than a decade, artificial intelligence has helped one Pittsburgh startup unravel the complexity to spot trends that can help rescue victims and even prosecute those responsible for their exploitation.
content:

title: Many in favour of AI being used to create new work from musicians who have died
description: More than half of UK adults are in favour of artificial intelligence (AI) being used to create new music from musicians who have died, such as John Lennon, Elvis Presley and Freddie Mercury, research has found.
content:
More than half of UK adults are in favour of artificial intelligence (AI) being used to create new music from musicians who have died, such as John Lennon, Elvis Presley and Freddie Mercury, research has found.

title: We cannot afford any complacency: Even a new year free of shake-ups would test our resolve
description: In a world shaken up by tariffs, wars and artificial intelligence (AI), India’s economy fared remarkably well in 2025. The public policy response was sharp, but the private sector must ask itself why it was largely missing in action. It’s time for Corporate India to step up and show determination.
content: As the sun sets on 2025 and the calendar gets reset for 2026, it might be worthwhile to take a moment to reflect upon what whizzed past as a means of getting a better handle on what awaits us. Two big-picture events and one big technology trend monop... [2922 chars]

title: Opinion: Despite fears, AI could reduce work week and better people’s quality of life
description: Consider this recent MSN headline: "Why is Amazon spending billions of dollars to expand but slashing 14,000 jobs?" According to the story, the company plans to invest US$20bil (RM80.9bil) in a new artificial intelligence campus and data centers while reducing the human workforce.
content:

title: Musk's xAI buys third building to expand AI compute power
description: Dec 30 (Reuters) - Elon Musk ‌said on Tuesday his artificial intelligence startup xAI has ‌bought a third building to expand its infrastructure, ‌aiming to boost training capacity to nearly 2 gigawatts of compute power.
content:

title: Global Stocks Post Biggest Annual Gain in Six Years as Fed Cuts and AI Drive Markets
description: Global equity markets are concluding 2024 with their strongest performance in six years, led by a 21% gain in the MSCI All Country World Index driven by Federal Reserve rate cuts and artificial intelligence enthusiasm. While precious metals like gold and silver recorded their best annual gains since 1979, the US dollar suffered its worst decline since 2017 at 8.10%, and recent Fed meeting minutes revealed growing divisions among policymakers over future rate cuts despite reinforcing expectations for continued easing.
content: Global equity markets are wrapping up 2024 with their strongest annual performance in six years, driven by Federal Reserve interest rate cuts and surging enthusiasm for artificial intelligence companies. The MSCI All Country World Index, one of the b... [6263 chars]

title: Global stocks poised for their biggest annual gain in six years
description: Global stocks are set for their largest annual gain in six years. This surge is driven by the Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts and strong interest in artificial intelligence companies. Precious metals like gold and silver are also experiencing significant jumps. However, Bitcoin faces a decline.
content:
